snp1.4:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Magadhans in the Southern Hills near the brahmin village of Ekanāḷa.
snp1.4:1.3: Now at that time the brahmin Bhāradvāja the Farmer had harnessed around five hundred plows, it being the season for sowing.
snp1.4:1.4: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, went to where Bhāradvāja the Farmer was working.
snp1.4:1.5: Now at that time Bhāradvāja the Farmer was distributing food.
snp1.4:1.6: Then the Buddha went to where the distribution was taking place and stood to one side.
snp1.4:2.1: Bhāradvāja the Farmer saw him standing for alms
